title: SEC-Ripple Litigation: A Monumental Victory for Crypto Clarity
body: BitcoinWorld SEC-Ripple Litigation: A Monumental Victory for Crypto Clarity The cryptocurrency world is buzzing with truly monumental news! The long-running SEC-Ripple litigation has officially come to a close. This development marks a significant turning point for Ripple, its associated digital asset XRP, and indeed, the entire landscape of cryptocurrency regulation . The End of a Saga: What Happened with the SEC-Ripple Litigation? For years, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and blockchain company Ripple Labs have been locked in a high-stakes legal battle. The core of the dispute revolved around whether Ripple‚Äôs XRP token constituted an unregistered security. Recently, both parties filed a joint motion to dismiss the appeal. This crucial step, confirmed by former federal prosecutor James Filan via X, signifies a mutual agreement to end the legal proceedings. Furthermore, both the SEC and Ripple agreed to bear their own legal costs and fees, effectively drawing the curtain on this prolonged legal saga. This resolution brings much-needed finality. It removes a significant cloud of uncertainty that has hung over Ripple and the broader crypto market for nearly three years. Understanding the Ripple Lawsuit: Key Milestones The Ripple lawsuit began in December 2020 when the SEC accused Ripple of conducting an unregistered securities offering through its sales of XRP. This accusation sent shockwaves through the crypto industry, leading to delistings of XRP on several exchanges and a significant impact on its market value. However, Ripple consistently maintained that XRP was not a security. They argued it served as a digital asset for payments, distinct from traditional investment contracts. A pivotal moment occurred in July 2023 when Judge Analisa Torres ruled that XRP, when sold on secondary markets to retail investors, was not a security. This partial victory for Ripple was celebrated widely as a landmark decision for digital asset clarity . December 2020: SEC files lawsuit against Ripple. July 2023: Court rules XRP not a security on secondary markets. October 2023: SEC and Ripple file joint motion to dismiss appeal, officially closing the case. What Does This Mean for XRP Price and Beyond? The official closure of the SEC-Ripple litigation has immediate and long-term implications. For XRP holders, the removal of legal uncertainty is a significant positive. While the market reaction to the initial July ruling was substantial, this final dismissal solidifies that clarity. Ripple can now operate with greater confidence in the United States. This allows them to focus on their core business of facilitating global payments through their On-Demand Liquidity (ODL) service, which utilizes XRP. Increased institutional adoption and partnerships could follow. This development also sets a precedent, even if not legally binding in all cases, for how other digital assets might be viewed by regulators. It underscores the importance of clear judicial rulings in shaping the future of crypto. Seeking Digital Asset Clarity: A Broader Perspective The conclusion of the Ripple lawsuit is a beacon for the wider crypto industry, which has long grappled with regulatory ambiguity. Many projects and companies face similar questions regarding the classification of their tokens. This outcome highlights the urgent need for comprehensive legislative frameworks rather than regulation through enforcement actions. Clear rules benefit innovation, protect consumers, and foster a healthy market. For investors and developers, this provides actionable insights: Stay Informed: Understand the evolving regulatory landscape. Focus on Utility: Projects with clear utility beyond speculative investment may find more favorable regulatory treatment. Advocate for Clarity: Support initiatives pushing for clear and sensible cryptocurrency regulation . While this particular chapter closes, the broader discussion on how to regulate digital assets responsibly continues. A New Era for Crypto? The official closure of the SEC-Ripple litigation is more than just a legal victory for Ripple; it represents a significant stride towards greater digital asset clarity . It demonstrates that judicial processes can indeed provide much-needed guidance in the absence of specific legislation. This landmark resolution empowers Ripple to fully pursue its vision for global payments and offers a glimmer of hope for a more predictable regulatory environment in the U.S. crypto market. The crypto community eagerly watches to see how this newfound clarity will shape future innovation and investment. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. What was the core issue of the SEC-Ripple litigation? The SEC alleged that Ripple conducted an unregistered securities offering by selling its XRP token. Ripple maintained that XRP was a digital asset for payments, not a security. 2. What was the final outcome of the Ripple lawsuit? The SEC and Ripple filed a joint motion to dismiss the appeal, effectively closing the case. Both parties agreed to bear their own legal costs. 3. How does this resolution impact the XRP price? The closure removes a significant legal overhang, which is generally seen as positive for XRP. It brings more certainty and could potentially lead to increased adoption and trading activity. 4. What does this mean for broader cryptocurrency regulation? This outcome sets a significant precedent, particularly regarding the classification of digital assets sold on secondary markets. It emphasizes the need for legislative clarity over enforcement actions in the crypto space. 5. Is Ripple completely free from all legal issues now? While the long-running SEC lawsuit is closed, Ripple, like any other major company, may still face other legal or regulatory considerations in different jurisdictions or related to other aspects of its business. 6. How does this contribute to digital asset clarity? The court‚Äôs prior ruling, combined with this dismissal, provides a clearer judicial interpretation of how XRP is classified under certain circumstances, offering a blueprint for similar cases and informing future regulatory discussions. If you found this article insightful, consider sharing it with your network! Help us spread the word about this pivotal development in the crypto space. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping digital assets institutional adoption . This post SEC-Ripple Litigation: A Monumental Victory for Crypto Clarity first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Whales Wallet Watching, How to Track Smart Money Using Arkham Intelligence
body: Cryptocurrency whales, wallets holding huge coin piles, leave big ripples in the market. Unlike stocks, every crypto move is public: as one analyst notes, ‚Äúevery transaction, whether it‚Äôs a buy, a sell, or a massive token allocation ‚Äì is permanently recorded on the blockchain . ‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs like having a live 13-F feed‚Ä¶ without the three-month delay‚Äù. In other words, smart money in crypto (whales and big investors) can be followed in real time. Platforms like Arkham Intelligence let anyone watch these wallets with ease. Crypto‚Äôs transparency is a game-changer. Instead of waiting for quarterly filings, crypto traders can see big investors acting on-chain. That‚Äôs smart capital moving before the crowd catches on. In short, watching whale wallets can give a sneak peek at where the market is headed to. Arkham Intelligence: The ‚ÄúBloomberg Terminal‚Äù of Crypto Today there are full-featured analytics platforms for crypto on-chain data. Arkham Intelligence, for example, has been called the ‚ÄúBloomberg Terminal of crypto‚Äù. It collates blockchain data into user-friendly dashboards. Arkham‚Äôs Token Pages let you instantly see the largest holders of any coin and chart major inflows/outflows. Arkham Platform Screenshot Showing The Individual Wallets Holding The Most Bitcoin Its Entity Tags recognize big players ‚Äì for example, Arkham has identified 96% of MicroStrategy‚Äôs bitcoin holdings and tagged over a million BTC as Satoshi Nakamoto‚Äôs stash. By surfacing labeled wallets and flows, Arkham makes whale-watching easy. For example, Arkham‚Äôs public Bitcoin token page shows the richest BTC holders and any large transfers between them. If a whale moves funds to an exchange or into a DeFi pool, Arkham highlights the incoming/outgoing transactions. Many traders set up dashboards or alerts on Arkham so they are notified when a tagged wallet moves millions. Real-World Whales Move Several whale ‚Äúwake-ups‚Äù have already been flagged on Arkham. In one Arkham report, a 13-year‚Äëold Bitcoin mining reward woke up and moved funds. ‚ÄúAn ancient BTC whale has woken up, transferring a total of 10 BTC into Kraken‚Ä¶ The whale first received 2,000 BTC tokens 13 years ago‚Ä¶ These BTC tokens were block rewards mined in February and March 2009,‚Äù the Arkham researchers detail. (Today that 10‚ÄØBTC was worth about $530,000.) In another Arkham report , a dormant wallet reactivated after eight years: ‚ÄúA Bitcoin whale has reawoken‚Ä¶ to transfer 3,000 BTC worth just over $252M‚Äù. These examples show why whale tracking matters. When such a large stash moves, it often presages market action. That‚Äôs from taking profits to shifting strategy. With Arkham‚Äôs insights, even beginners can see these signals. You don‚Äôt need to know the real-life identity behind the wallet, it could be a corporation or an early miner, but you can see the coins move. And because Arkham tags exchanges and institutions, you often know what the whale likely is (e.g. ‚ÄúMicroStrategy‚Äôs cold wallet‚Äù or ‚ÄúBitstamp deposit address‚Äù). How to Use Arkham to Follow Whales Create an Arkham account. Arkham offers a free tier that lets you explore coin token pages, wallet profiles, and flow charts. As the Arkham guides put it, simply sign up to Arkham and review the Bitcoin token page to see the top token holders. Use Token Pages for overview. For any cryptocurrency (Bitcoin, Ethereum, etc.), visit its Arkham token page. There you‚Äôll find the Top Holders list: the biggest wallets sorted by balance, often labeled (Exchanges, projects, or known whales). You‚Äôll also see charts of Largest Inflows/Outflows over time. Search and explore wallets. If you know a whale‚Äôs address (or have Arkham‚Äôs entity name for it), paste it into Arkham‚Äôs explorer. You‚Äôll see its current balance, age, and all transactions. Use filters and labels. On Arkham you can filter holder lists to include only unlabeled whales (unknown wallets), or only known institutions. Many traders follow Arkham‚Äôs whale feeds. Set alerts and dashboards. Once you identify a whale wallet of interest, set up an Arkham alert (or add it to a custom dashboard) so you get notified on any big moves. These steps turn Arkham into a ‚Äúcheat code‚Äù for smart money. By following Arkham‚Äôs labeled data, even newcomers can track where big capital is flowing. Rather than chasing price charts, you follow the capital charts, follow the money. Key Steps to Start Whale Watching Identify target whales. Begin with known big players: search Arkham for public companies (e.g. MicroStrategy , Tesla ), exchanges (e.g. Coinbase , Binance ), or famous early miners (Satoshi‚Äôs addresses). Arkham will show their tagged wallets. Watch token pages. For a token you care about, check its Arkham page. Large sudden deposits or withdrawals from top holders often precede big moves. Explore unknown whales. Sometimes Arkham‚Äôs ‚ÄúTop Unknown Holders ‚Äù list highlights big wallets with no public identity. Explore their history; Arkham‚Äôs Visualizer tool can trace funds through layers of addresses. Monitor whale feeds. Follow Arkham‚Äôs blog or Twitter for alerts (‚ÄúArkham Intel‚Äù) ‚Äì they frequently report on awakened whales. For example, Arkham‚Äôs Twitter/X feed has real-time posts when it spots big moves. React wisely. Use whale data as a signal, not a single tip. If multiple tagged whales are accumulating or selling, it‚Äôs often a strong cue. Combine it with your own research before making trades. Conclusion In crypto, capital flows speak louder than headlines . By watching whale wallets, you essentially peek at the trades of the savviest investors. Arkham Intelligence makes this possible by turning raw blockchain data into clear insights. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or an experienced trader, using Arkham to track whales is now like reading the smartest traders‚Äô order tickets. Disclosure: This is not trading or investment advice. title: Bitcoin Short-Term Holders Are Capitulating‚ÄîWill June Pattern Repeat?
body: On-chain data shows that the Bitcoin short-term holders have switched to loss-taking recently. Here‚Äôs what this could mean for the asset. Bitcoin Short-Term Holder SOPR Has Dropped Below 1.0 In a new post on X, the on-chain analysis platform Checkonchain has talked about how the behavior of the Bitcoin short-term holders has changed recently. The indicator shared by Checkonchain is the Spent Output Profit Ratio (SOPR), which tells us about whether the BTC investors are selling/moving their coins at a profit or loss. Related Reading: Dogecoin Whales Buy The Dip: $1 Billion DOGE Added When the value of the metric is greater than 1, it means the holders as a whole are participating in profit-taking. On the other hand, it being under the mark suggests the market is realizing a net loss. In the context of the current discussion, the SOPR of the entire network isn‚Äôt of interest, but rather that of only a specific part of it: the short-term holders (STHs). This cohort includes the holders who purchased their coins in the past 155 days. Statistically, the longer investors hold onto their coins, the less likely they are to sell them at any point. But since the STH group is made up of holders with a short holding time, conviction tends to be weak among its members, with panic selloffs often taking place. Recently, Bitcoin has seen a decline, so it would be expected that the STHs would have shown some kind of reaction. Below is the chart shared by the analytics firm, showing the nature of selling that the cohort has participated in. As is visible in the graph, the Bitcoin STH SOPR shot up to a notable level above 1 when the asset‚Äôs price set its all-time high (ATH), indicating that these fickle-minded hands took the opportunity of the rally to exit in profit. The profit-taking, however, declined in the consolidation phase that followed this peak, and the recent bearish price action has outright pushed the metric below 1. The indicator currently has a value of 0.99, which is still almost neutral, but it does show that some top buyers have started to capitulate. As Checkonchain explains, ‚Äúmany recent top buyers and ‚ÄòWeaker‚Äô hands are selling around their buy-in price and saying ‚Äòget me out.'‚Äù In the past, capitulation events from the Bitcoin STHs have often meant a flush of weak hands, facilitating bottom formations for the cryptocurrency. Sometimes these events can go on for a while before the market reaches a turnaround, as happened in the lead-up to the April low. Related Reading: Binance Inflows A Leading Indicator For Altcoins? Analyst Explains How But interestingly, the STH SOPR‚Äôs dip into the loss-taking zone in June was quite short-lived and led into a quick reversal for the asset. It now remains to be seen which trend will play out for BTC this time. BTC Price Bitcoin has shown some recovery during the past day as its price has jumped to $116,400. Featured image from Dall-E, charts.checkonchain.com, chart from TradingView.com

title: Ethereum L2s Drain ETH, Centralize Control: Galaxy‚Äòs Thorn Warns
body: Galaxy Digital‚Äôs head of research Alex Thorn ignited a fresh debate over Ethereum‚Äôs roll-up economy on Wednesday, accusing leading Layer-2 networks of siphoning value from the main chain while leaving ETH holders with ‚Äúpennies.‚Äù In a widely shared thread on X, Thorn argued that ‚Äúafter all these years, the ethereum community is apparently fine that most users are operating on centralized L2s controlled by single companies or foundations‚Ä¶ very little value accrual back to ETH holders‚Ä¶ sad!‚Äù Ethereum L2s: Centralized, Profitable And Bleeding ETH Dry According to Thorn, roll-ups now earn between $100 000 and $400 000 in daily fees yet ‚Äúhaven‚Äôt spent more than 1/1000 of a penny daily to buy blob objects since May,‚Äù pushing less than $10,000 per day to Ethereum for data availability. He highlighted Base‚ÄîCoinbase‚Äôs OP-Stack roll-up‚Äîas the most conspicuous example: over the past 180 days Base paid just $3.05 million to Ethereum L1 while sending $4.4 million to the Optimism Collective that licenses its code. ‚ÄúBase is paying more daily to the Optimism Collective than all L2s combined (including Base) are paying to Ethereum L1,‚Äù Thorn wrote, calling the margin ‚Äúa nice business.‚Äù The numbers grow starker in Coinbase ‚Äôs own filings. Thorn noted that in Q2 2025 Base generated $14.9 million in user fees, spent only $443,000 on Ethereum data costs and $2.16 million on Optimism royalties‚Äîjust as the exchange disclosed a quarterly purchase of 2,509 BTC worth $247 million. ‚ÄúIs Coinbase siphoning value from Ethereum and using the proceeds to buy bitcoin?‚Äù he asked, framing the decision as evidence that roll-ups can divert economic gravity away from ETH toward alternative assets. Coinbase‚Äôs July 31 X post confirms the bitcoin accumulation: 11,776 BTC held at a $740 million cost basis, now valued at $1.26 billion. Buterin Highlights Technical Roadmap While Thorn‚Äôs critique centered on economics and governance, Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin shared a technocratic roadmap focused on L2 user experience. Celebrating that ‚Äúso many major L2s are now at stage 1,‚Äù Buterin argued that the next milestone must be sub-one-hour native withdrawals‚Äîultimately shrinking to a single slot‚Äîenabled by validity (ZK) proofs rather than optimistic schemes that require week-long challenge periods. ‚ÄúWaiting a week to withdraw is far too long‚Ä¶ This creates incentives to instead use solutions with unacceptable trust assumptions that undermine the whole point of having L2s,‚Äù he wrote, urging builders to adopt hybrid proof systems (ZK + OP + TEE or variants) that deliver speed without sacrificing trustlessness. Buterin acknowledged that frequent ZK proofs remain costly‚Äîsingle submissions today consume roughly 500,000 gas‚Äîyet anticipated near-term aggregation of many roll-up proofs into one, uploaded ‚Äúonce per slot,‚Äù unlocking near-instant cross-L2 liquidity while keeping Ethereum the settlement and asset-issuance hub. In his view, technical convergence on validity proofs will erode the advantage of centralized multi-sig bridges that Thorn decries, restoring both security and economic alignment. For now the gulf between the two perspectives remains. Thorn views the status quo as extraction: centralized sequencers capture margins while remitting negligible fees to stakers, and governance remains anchored in corporate committees rather than permissionless validators. Buterin counters that the pathway to stronger alignment lies through cryptographic engineering that removes the week-long friction keeping capital parked in L2 coffers. Whether economics or engineering wins the argument may hinge on how quickly roll-ups can deploy cheap ZK systems‚Äî and whether users will wait for the upgrade or continue rewarding the most profitable sequencers in the meantime. At press time, ETH traded at $3,841.

title: Ethereum-Based DeFi Protocol Euler (EUL) on the Rise Following Coinbase Listing
body: An Ethereum ( ETH )-based decentralized finance (DeFi) altcoin is on the rise after gaining support from the top US-based crypto exchange platform. In a new thread, Coinbase says it is adding support for Euler ( EUL ), a lending and borrowing protocol built on top of the second-largest digital asset by market cap. ‚ÄúEuler (EUL) is now live on http://coinbase.com and in the Coinbase iOS and Android apps. Coinbase customers can log in to buy, sell, convert, send, receive or store these assets.‚Äù Following the announcement, EUL saw a price increase, rising from an August 6th low of $11.02 to a peak of $12.17 just a day later. The asset has since stabilized and is currently trading at $11.77, representing a 5.7% increase over the last 24 hours. According to its official website , Euler is a modular DeFi platform that features permissionless vault creation, allowing anyone to create a lending vault for a specific asset using the ERC-4626 token protocol, an extension of the popular ERC-20 standard that extends its reach to yield-bearing vault tokens. ‚ÄúVaults are the fundamental building blocks of the Euler protocol, serving as the primitive unit for all lending and borrowing activities‚Ä¶ EVK (Euler Vault Kit) vaults are extended ERC-4626 vaults that function as passive lending pools. Unlike standard ERC-4626 vaults that generate yield through active investment strategies, EVK vaults earn yield by lending assets to borrowers. These vaults accept ERC-20 token deposits and enable users to borrow against their collateral.‚Äù Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Don't Miss a Beat ‚Äì Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Winklevoss Twins Bitcoin Investment: Unlocking Surprising Trump-Linked Crypto Ventures
body: BitcoinWorld Winklevoss Twins Bitcoin Investment: Unlocking Surprising Trump-Linked Crypto Ventures The cryptocurrency world is constantly evolving, and a recent development has certainly captured attention: a significant Winklevoss twins Bitcoin investment . Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, widely recognized for their pioneering work in the crypto space and co-founding the Gemini exchange, have reportedly invested in American Bitcoin. This particular Bitcoin mining firm carries a notable connection, as it was co-founded by Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump. This news, initially reported by Bloomberg, highlights a deepening of ties between prominent figures in the digital asset industry and a politically influential family. While the exact investment amount remains undisclosed, the move itself sends a clear signal about the expanding landscape of digital asset investment . What‚Äôs Behind the Winklevoss Twins Bitcoin Investment? The decision by the Winklevoss twins to back American Bitcoin is more than just a financial transaction; it‚Äôs a strategic alignment. This investment positions them alongside a company with unique political connections, which could have various implications for the future of crypto adoption and regulation. Strategic Alignment: The investment in American Bitcoin, a Bitcoin mining firm , aligns with the Winklevoss‚Äôs long-standing belief in Bitcoin‚Äôs foundational role in the digital economy. Political Ties: The involvement of Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump in American Bitcoin brings a distinct layer of visibility and discussion. These Trump crypto ties are now undeniable. Market Confidence: Such investments from established crypto figures often signal confidence in the long-term viability and growth of the sector, particularly in the infrastructure supporting it. This development suggests that major players are looking beyond just trading and into the core operations that secure the Bitcoin network. Exploring American Bitcoin Mining and its Future American Bitcoin is not just another startup; it is a player in the crucial sector of cryptocurrency mining. This process is fundamental to securing blockchain networks and verifying transactions, making it a vital part of the crypto ecosystem. The company is currently undergoing a significant transformation. Cointelegraph reported that American Bitcoin is planning a merger with Gryphon Digital Mining. This potential merger is a key aspect of the firm‚Äôs trajectory. Expansion: A merger with Gryphon Digital Mining could substantially expand American Bitcoin‚Äôs operational capacity and market share in American Bitcoin mining . Industry Consolidation: This move reflects a broader trend of consolidation within the competitive Bitcoin mining industry, where efficiency and scale are increasingly important. Future Prospects: The combined entity would likely aim for greater operational efficiency and a stronger position in the global mining landscape, attracting further Bitcoin mining investment . How will this merger reshape the landscape for other mining operations? The Significance of Trump Crypto Ties in the Digital Asset Space The involvement of high-profile political families in the cryptocurrency space is always noteworthy. The Trump crypto ties through American Bitcoin add a new dimension to the ongoing dialogue about digital assets. This connection could influence several areas: Mainstream Acceptance: It might contribute to the mainstream acceptance of cryptocurrencies by associating them with well-known public figures, even if controversial. Regulatory Scrutiny: Conversely, it could draw increased regulatory attention to the crypto industry, potentially leading to new policies or discussions around transparency and compliance. Public Perception: The association could sway public opinion, either positively or negatively, depending on individual perspectives towards the Trump family. This makes digital asset investment even more complex. Ultimately, such partnerships highlight the growing intersection of traditional power structures and the nascent digital economy. Why is This Bitcoin Mining Investment Important? Any significant Bitcoin mining investment from figures like the Winklevoss twins warrants attention. It speaks volumes about the perceived stability and long-term potential of Bitcoin‚Äôs underlying infrastructure. Consider these points: Institutional Confidence: It signals continued institutional and high-net-worth individual confidence in the crypto sector, moving beyond speculative trading into fundamental infrastructure. Infrastructure Focus: The focus on mining indicates a belief in the necessity and profitability of the foundational layer of the Bitcoin network. Market Dynamics: This investment could influence market dynamics by attracting more capital to the mining sector, potentially increasing competition and innovation. This event underscores that Bitcoin is not just a digital currency but a robust technological network attracting serious capital. In conclusion, the Winklevoss twins Bitcoin investment in American Bitcoin, a firm with prominent Trump crypto ties and a planned merger with Gryphon Digital Mining, marks a compelling development. This move solidifies the growing interest in American Bitcoin mining and the broader digital asset investment landscape. It illustrates how the worlds of finance, technology, and even politics are increasingly intertwining within the dynamic cryptocurrency ecosystem. This strategic Bitcoin mining investment could pave the way for further mainstream adoption and influence future regulatory discussions. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: Who are the Winklevoss twins and what is American Bitcoin? The Winklevoss twins, Cameron and Tyler, are well-known entrepreneurs and investors in the cryptocurrency space, co-founders of the Gemini exchange. American Bitcoin is a Bitcoin mining firm co-founded by Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump, focusing on cryptocurrency mining operations. Q2: What is the significance of the Trump family‚Äôs involvement in American Bitcoin? The involvement of the Trump family introduces a unique political dimension to the crypto industry. It could influence public perception, attract mainstream attention, and potentially draw increased regulatory scrutiny to the digital asset space. Q3: What does this investment mean for the Bitcoin mining industry? This Winklevoss twins Bitcoin investment signifies growing confidence from prominent crypto figures in the foundational infrastructure of Bitcoin. It highlights a trend towards strategic investments in mining operations, potentially leading to more industry consolidation and innovation. Q4: Is American Bitcoin merging with another company? Yes, American Bitcoin is reportedly planning a merger with Gryphon Digital Mining. This merger could significantly expand its operational capacity and market share within the American Bitcoin mining sector. Q5: How does this investment impact the broader digital asset landscape? This investment deepens the intersection of traditional finance, technology, and politics within the digital asset space. It underscores the evolving nature of digital asset investment and could pave the way for further mainstream adoption and influence future regulatory discussions. title: Ripple Vs SEC: The Historic Legal Battle Ends After 4 Years
body: The long-standing legal dispute between the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and blockchain payment company Ripple Labs, has officially concluded, following the new regulatory dawn for digital assets in the US. SEC And Ripple Agree To Dismiss Appeals In a recent court filing , both the SEC and Ripple announced their agreement to dismiss their appeals, effectively ending one of the most scrutinized lawsuits in the crypto sector‚Äôs history. The joint stipulation of dismissal was submitted to the US Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, where both parties confirmed their decision to withdraw the SEC‚Äôs appeal (No. 24-2648) and Ripple‚Äôs cross-appeal (No. 24-2705). Notably, the agreement stipulates that each party will bear its own legal costs and fees. This resolution comes after nearly four years of legal wrangling that has significantly impacted the cryptocurrency industry. The saga began in December 2020, when the SEC filed a lawsuit against Ripple Labs and its top executives, accusing them of conducting unregistered securities offerings through the sale of XRP. Ripple has consistently maintained that XRP is a digital currency, not a security. Chief Legal Officer Celebrates Court Victory The case has seen numerous developments, including a crucial ruling in July 2023 by Judge Analisa Torres of the Southern District of New York. The judge determined that XRP sales on public exchanges did not qualify as securities transactions, a partial victory for Ripple. However, the court allowed the case to continue on other grounds, particularly concerning institutional sales of XRP. Ripple‚Äôs Chief Legal Officer, Stuart Alderoty, took to social media platform X (formerly Twitter) to express his thoughts on the conclusion of the legal battle. He noted the Commission‚Äôs vote and highlighted the formal filing to dismiss the appeals, stating, ‚ÄúThe end‚Ä¶ and now back to business.‚Äù Featured image from DALL-E, chart from TradingView.com
